original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge up in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged up in mid day trade on Wednesday, on the International Monetary Fund (IMF) loan agreement coming to it conclusion by March 20, an analyst said.
“The market is moving sustainably and is healthy because the market moves between profit taking and buying interests, these are considered positive factors and contributors,” an analyst said.
All Share Price Index was up 0.72 percent or 68.57 points to 9,619.27, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 1.00 percent or 28.03 points to 2,819.36.
The market generated a revenue of 1.1 billion rupees during 1200 hours.
“The turnover is slow because people are entering minimal profit taking, not eagerly wanting to dump shares and sell them,” an analyst said.
Buying was mainly seen in financial indexes, retail counters and construction indexes.
Top gainers were Commercial Bank, John Keells Holdings and Browns Investment. (Colombo/Mar15/2023)
